msgSnippet: ... I have a feeling the ReloadingTestSuiteLoader wanted to create a new classloader each time the test was run.  That way the test classes can be reloaded so
messageBody:
> From: ericheikkila [mailto:ericheikkila@...]
>
> Commented the line out and it runs fine now.
>
> DOH!
>
> So what would a better solution be?


I have a feeling the ReloadingTestSuiteLoader wanted to create a
new classloader each time the test was run. That way the test
classes can be reloaded so that when Junit runs your tests, it
is always with the most current jars/classes.

In order for that to work properly, we probably need the
setContextClassloader.

Try looking at where the classloader that they are passing in is
created.
Uncomment out the line you did, and make sure they are creating the
classloader with the context classloader as a parent.

I just downloaded 3.8, so I can look at creating a patch soon.
